title: Euler Totient Function
text:
EnglishVietnameseIn number theory, the totient φ of a positive integer n is defined to be the number of positive integers less than or equal to n that are coprime to n.Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 106). Compute the value of the totient φ.InputFirst line contains an integer T, the number of test cases. (T ≤ 20000)T following lines, each contains an integer n.OutputT lines, one for the result of each test case.ExampleInput:5
1
2
3
4
5Output:1
1
2
2
4
